title: Dyan Birch
text:
Dyan Joan Birch (25 January 1949 – 10 October 2020) was an English singer.
Born in <a href="Liverpool">Liverpool</a>, Birch worked as a teenager in <a href="Brian%20Epstein">Brian Epstein</a>'s NEMS record shop in the city. In 1969 she and her friends formed the band <a href="Arrival%20%28band%29">Arrival</a>, and moved to London. The group had two UK chart hits in 1970, "Friends" and "I Will Survive", both featuring Birch, and played at the <a href="Isle%20of%20Wight%20Festival%201970">Isle of Wight Festival</a> that year. The group later expanded and changed style, becoming <a href="Kokomo%20%28band%29">Kokomo</a>, who were successful in London pubs and clubs in the mid-1970s. Several members of the band became respected <a href="session%20musician">session musician</a>s, and Birch became a <a href="backing%20singer">backing singer</a> on records by <a href="Bryan%20Ferry">Bryan Ferry</a>, <a href="Gloria%20Gaynor">Gloria Gaynor</a>, <a href="Frankie%20Miller">Frankie Miller</a>, <a href="Marianne%20Faithfull">Marianne Faithfull</a>, <a href="Manfred%20Mann%27s%20Earth%20Band">Manfred Mann's Earth Band</a> and <a href="Alvin%20Lee">Alvin Lee</a>.
She was the younger sister of the late Pamela Birch of <a href="The%20Liverbirds">The Liverbirds</a>.
Birch died on 10 October 2020 from <a href="chronic%20obstructive%20pulmonary%20disease">chronic obstructive pulmonary disease</a>, at the age of 71.
